N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 304.3 - Exercise

State Regulations

Incarcerated individuals confined in the SHU must be permitted one
hour of outdoor exercise daily, exclusive of the time it takes to go to and return
from the exercise area, beginning on the day following admission. (a) Incarcerated individuals normally will be
offered the opportunity for outdoor exercise despite weather conditions. If during
the exercise period the weather significantly deteriorates, the incarcerated
individual may request and shall be permitted to return to his/her cell. If this
occurs, the outdoor exercise opportunity for that day will be considered to have
been satisfied. (b) Except at
double-celled SHU's, coats and galoshes or rubbers will be maintained on the unit
and will be provided during exercise periods in the event of cold or inclement
weather. (c) On those rare occasions
when the weather so reduces visibility that it significantly impacts the ability of
security staff to visually observe the exercise area (i.e., fog, blizzard, etc.), exercise may be curtailed for the duration of the extreme weather conditions by
issuance of a deprivation order in accord with section
305.2
of this

Title. (d) Repealed
